text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with the last episode of follow the
sourdough day 8 we bake bread finally it
seems like only a week ago we started
this
all right the dough has risen it's more
than doubled in size and see when I poke
my fingers see how it doesn't poke back
at me that dough is risen and ready to
go so we're going to plop it on the
cutting board and we're going to what's
called punch it down I don't punch it I
just kind of you know stretch it and
push it down so basically we're going to
deflate the dough which is fine don't
worry all right we're going to kind of
stretch it into a somewhat square oval
shape and then I'm going to turn it over
so that the drier side is up okay so
that's the side that was the surface and
I'm just going to take it I'm going to
roll it into a loaf shape now you don't
want any major air pockets but don't
worry about any little small ones is
this rises it will it will all seal
together now make sure your seam is at
the bottom don't worry too much about
the ends so just put on your cutting
board and just kind of shape into a nice
loaf seam down the ends are just kind of
padded in and that's it very simple on a
sturdy baking sheet you want to sprinkle
some corn meal and you're going to place
your loaf right on top and we're going
to let this rise until it's doubled in
size if you thought we were going to
bake right away no we're going to let
this rise double in size now you got to
get a squeeze bottle with water this is
crucial for the baking step and you'll
see why but as this rises I don't want
to dry out I want the the surface to
stay kind of elastic I don't like to
cover it some people put a bowl over it
I'm just going to give it a little
spritz with water and we're going to let
that rise until it is doubled in size
which you see right there so that took
me about five hours so again I'm not
going to really give you specific times
because it's going to depend on the
temperature and you know how harder your
yeast is so anyway mine's risen I'm
going to take a knife and I'm going to
give it some slashes about a half-inch
deep across the surface that's just not
for looks it's partly for looks but it
actually will let the bread expand when
it cooks now I'm going to prep my
I have a pan of water at the bottom very
crucial I'm going to take my water spray
bottle and I'm going to spritz my dough
I'm going to put it in my oven which is
cold and I'm going to put my oven on 425
and I'm going to let the oven heat up
with the bread in it after 10 minutes it
probably will be close to the
temperature I'm going to take it out I'm
going to spritz it with water I'm going
to put it back in and I'm going to
spritz it with water about every 10
minutes three or four times okay so this
spritzing with water you see it making
the steam when it hits that pan all
right that combined with the steam from
the water pan in there really gives that
crust its beautiful shiny blistered
bakery look so kind of try to be quick
here like I am doing just give it a
spritz turn it around give it a spritz
throw it back in so you don't lose too
much heat and you're going to bake that
mine took about 40 minutes it can go
anywhere from you know 35 45 minutes
depending and what comes out is the most
unbelievably beautiful loaf of bread it
have a beautiful crispy crust at least
when it's freshly baked by the way if
you're going to do lots of baking you
got to get one of these cooling racks
all right you can hear that hear that
that how will sound when you tap it you
know it's cooked and you see those
little kind of flaky blisters that's
really what that water was for and
that's the professional ovens actually
have steam valves in them anyway you can
do that at home with a spray bottle and
the pan of water in the oven and there
you go now you know how they say it's
the journey not the destination with
this project it's both the journey is
fun it's it's kind of dangerous it's
kind of a science experiment but when
you're done you get to eat bread and I
hope yours came out it probably did it
takes some practice but I hope you got
the bug now to try to make sourdough
check the site watch all the videos and
make some sourdough enjoy
you
